definitions.definition: treating someone in a way that is right or reasonable, or treating a group of people equally and not allowing personal opinions to influence your judgment:
If something is fair, it is reasonable and is what you expect or deserve:
examples: I thought it was a fair price that she was offering.

definitions.definition: If a game or competition is fair, it is done according to the rules:
it is the right way to treat someone and what they deserve:
examples: I think it's only fair to tell you that we have had over 300 applications for this job.
I think it's fair to say (that) you've done less of the work than I have.

definitions.definition: considering everything that has an effect on a situation, so that a fair judgment can be made:
examples: He's done the job badly but, to be fair, I gave him very little time to do it.

definitions.definition: something you say to show that you understand why someone has done or said something:
examples: "I'm just annoyed with him because he's behaved so badly." "Fair enough."

definitions.definition: something that you say when you want someone to behave reasonably or treat you the same as other people:
examples: Come on, it's my turn. Fair's fair!

definitions.definition: an opportunity to explain something or give your opinions, without other people trying to influence the situation:
examples: He didn't think that he got a fair hearing in court.

definitions.definition: in an honest way and without any doubt:
examples: We won the match fair and square.

definitions.definition: If you hit someone fair and square on a particular part of their body, you hit that person hard, exactly on that part:
examples: He hit me fair and square on the nose.

definitions.definition: a large public event where goods are bought and sold, usually from tables that have been specially arranged for the event, and where there is often entertainment:
examples: I bought a wooden salad bowl at the local craft fair.

definitions.definition: an outside event where you can ride on large machines for pleasure and play games to win prizes
a large show at which people who work in a particular industry meet, and sell and advertise their products:
a public event in the countryside where farm animals and farm products are sold:
a public event, often held outside, where you can take part in competitions and buy small things and food, often organized to collect money for a particular purpose:
